channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dangerous Traffic Through Church Street, 4th September
item.description:
Balcarras School is concerned about the traffic that is being diverted through Church Street as a result of the closure of the A40. A number of our parents have reported near misses with pupils walking to and from the Junior School and the Secondary School.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, Church Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ratting ironwork outside Rockatech / by bus stop, 3rd September
item.description:
Clanks EVERY time a car goes in the direction of Pirton Corner. Has been reported previously over 6 months and nothing has been done. This needs fixing or securing to stop it rattling. It has been marked with spray paint for some considerable times but no work has been done. Please provide an update.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 207, Pirton Lane, Churchdown, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gridlock traffic and inappropriate vehicles diverting through village. Much too large to do so and causing major traffic issues at all hours of the day. Road by pub and Chinese takeaway is too narrow for both directions of traffic let alone with added diversions, 3rd September
item.description:
East end road, round st Mary’s church and all surrounding areas. Happened since London road closure on Monday 1st September due to continue til mid December. This cannot go on for over 3 months it is absolute carnage and somebody will get hurt. I am local resident who has to use this route to get anywhere- I am nearly 40 weeks pregnant and could go into labour at anytime and now have the added stress of not being able to travel anywhere without getting stuck in gridlock traffic!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 44A, Church Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very dangerous situation! We live on Church street, on the one way road around St Mary’s church, in Charlton Kings village. I have seen all day, the chaos that is prevailing in this area, including lorry’s mounting pavements, lorry’s going the wrong way because they are unable to get around the church, due to heavy vehicles and huge traffic using the village local traffic route, instead of the Cirencester Road diversion due to the A40 Charlton kings road works. Three schools are on this route, someone is going to get killed. Please sort better diversion signage, and this needs to be policed., 3rd September
item.description:
At Mary’s Church, Church Street, Charlton Kings (one way road around St Mary’s Church. Route not suitable for large heavy goods vehicles, lorry’s, and should not be used as a diversion due to A40 Charlton kings road closure.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Church Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Innsworth lane and rookery road junction zebra crossing missing, 3rd September
item.description:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to raise a serious safety concern regarding the junction of Innsworth Lane and Rookery Road. This area is used daily by hundreds of children attending Innsworth Junior School, along with parents, carers, and other pedestrians. At present, there is no pedestrian crossing facility, such as a zebra crossing, at this busy junction. As a result, children are regularly forced to cross the road while vehicles approach at considerable speed. This creates a highly unsafe environment, particularly during school drop-off and pick-up times when traffic levels are at their highest. The absence of a designated crossing point poses a significant risk of accidents and injuries. Installing a pedestrian crossing would greatly improve safety, reduce the likelihood of incidents, and provide reassurance to families and residents who use this route daily. I urge the council to give this matter urgent attention and to consider the installation of a zebra crossing or another appropriate traffic-calming measure at this junction. Thank you for your time and consideration. I look forward to your response.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Innsworth Lane, Innsworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A40 roadworks/diversion, 3rd September
item.description:
Chaos in Charlton Kings village. Proper signage needs to be employed stating 'Local Access Only' & 'No HGV access' whilst the roadworks are in place on the A40. We are only a matter of days into a potential very long term closure. It is only a matter of time before a serious incident occurs. Cars and lorries mounting pavements to get through. Long queues of traffic through the village. Children are now back to 3 schools in the vicinity. Please please please organise this better... and Police it! There has been months of run up to this closure. Diversions and signage have not been thought through adequately.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chestnut Terrace, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water Level in the drain seems High, 3rd September
item.description:
The level of water in the drains seems high, usually when cleaned there is around 121 cm now it is around 40-50 cm and as we have previously had flooding of the road, driveway, footpath and the side of our house could both drains at the bottom of Roxton Drive be cleaned. Both drains out side of number 7 and number 6 if possible to clean may help to avoid being flooded again. Thanks Keith
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Roxton Drive, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
